thread.title: How Samsung’s Galaxy S8 measures up to Galaxy S7 and iPhone 7
thread.title_full: How Samsung’s Galaxy S8 measures up to Galaxy S7 and iPhone 7

author: Mix
title: How Samsung’s Galaxy S8 measures up to Galaxy S7 and iPhone 7
text:
FIND OUT WHY 
While, at 5.8 inches, the new flagship handset is slightly bigger than the iPhone, it’s still a tad bit smaller than the S7, which measures at 5.94 inches. Here are the pictures: 
Thanks to its tiny bezels, the S8 still appears to be the more compact device when compared to the S7 – even though the latter packs a similarly sized 5.5-inch display. For more context, the panel for Samsung’s new flagship measures 5.54 inches and boasts an impressive 85 percent screen-to-body ratio. 
In addition to its awesome bezels, the flagship will likely come in three different colors and support for wireless charging . 
Samsung is slated to reveal the new S8 next week on March 29. The handset is expected to hit the shelves later in April at the price of €799 for the standard version and €899 for the bigger S8 Plus.
